name: Onion Chutney
history: Onion Chutney is a widely used condiment in Indian cuisine, known for its rich and savory flavor. It's a staple in many Indian households and varies in taste and texture across different regions of the country.
description: Onion Chutney is a tangy and spicy condiment made with onions, tomatoes, tamarind, and a variety of spices. It's commonly served with South Indian dishes like dosas and idlis but can also be used as a spread or dip.

instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, dry red chilies, and curry leaves. When the mustard seeds start to splutter, add the garlic and onions. SautÃ© until onions turn translucent, then add the tomatoes and cook until soft.

instructions.title: Blend the Mixture
instructions.description: Allow the mixture to cool. Add tamarind paste and salt. Blend the mixture to a smooth consistency in a blender.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Onion Chutney with dosas, idlis, or as a dip for snacks.

tips: Adjust the amount of red chilies based on your desired spice level.
Adding a pinch of sugar can balance the tartness of the tomatoes.
variations: Include a small piece of jaggery for a sweet and sour flavor.
Add a handful of fresh coriander leaves for a refreshing twist.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Onion Chutney is best served at room temperature and does not require reheating.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl with a spoon for easy use.
Garnish with a sprig of curry leaf for added color and aroma.
